se.lypson.common
Class Settings

java.lang.Object
  se.lypson.common.Settings

public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object

The Settings class stores values for keys, much like a hash table. However, unlike a normal hash table this class is designed to store the setting entries in a record store, thereby allowing the settings to be kept between different sessions of the application. Also unlike a normal hash table, this class is designed to store application wide settings. It is not possible to create two instances of Settings that does not share the same set of settings.

The Singleton Pattern is used to ensure only a single instance of this class is created, thereby emphasising the settings as a single global storage place for settings.

Record Store Sharing:
The record store is created as private record store. Other MIDLet suites cannot access them.
Thread Safety:
Public static and instance methods are thread-safe. Access to the setting entries are synchronized against the object returned by getLock().
Threads and Multiple Related Settings:
The class is safe for multiple threads accessing a single setting; however, to ensure safe access for multiple threads to a set of related settings, all access, both reading and writing to the settings, must be explicitly synchronized. Otherwise, it is possible for one thread to start changing the values of the related settings, another thread to access the settings where some values have been changed and other have not, resulting in a inconsistent set of values when the first thread continues to change the values of the related settings. In order to avoid this, it is recommended to synchronize against the object returned by getLock().

Author:
Tobias Persson

getStrings

public java.util.Enumeration getStrings(java.util.Enumeration keys)
                                 throws NoSuchKeyException,
                                        javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException,
                                        java.io.IOException
Returns the string values for an enumeration of setting keys.

Parameters:
keys - the setting keys to retrieve the values for.
Returns:
An enumeration of string values for the setting keys. The values are returned in the order specified by the setting keys.
Throws:
NoSuchKeyException - if there is no setting entry for one of the specified keys.
javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException - if a record store-related exception occurs.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O-related exception occurs.
